direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods retrieve values from a MultiValuedMap and convert them to a specific collection type (List vs. Bag) with similar control flow and exception handling.
Both methods retrieve values from a MultiValuedMap and convert them to a specific collection type (List vs. Set) with similar control flow and exception handling.
Both methods retrieve a collection of values from a MultiValuedMap for a given key, but getValuesAsList converts the collection to a List.
Both methods handle null input maps similarly, returning null or true respectively.
Both methods involve operations on MultiValuedMap instances, though newListValuedHashMap creates a new instance.

enhanced_by.reason: Both methods handle null input maps, ensuring a non-null state before proceeding.
getCollection can be used to retrieve the collection before converting it to a List in getValuesAsList.
Both methods handle null input maps, and isEmpty can be used to assert the state of the map after getValuesAsList.
